name: Rosée Sauce
description: Rosée sauce is what happens when alfredo and marinara strike up a saucy romance and tie the knot. It’s got the best of both: tomatoey tang and creamy, cheesy goodness. Whether you’re making it on the stovetop or in the microwave, dinner’s ready in a snap. Use it for pastas, pizzas, casseroles, and even hot dips.
preparation: In a saucepan, combine sauce mix with milk and tomato paste. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to low and simmer 3 min, or until thickened.
Or, in a 4-cup microwavable bowl, combine sauce mix with milk and tomato paste; whisk to combine. Microwave on high 4–5 min, or until thickened, whisking halfway through.
tips: One recipe of sauce is enough to coat 6 cups of cooked pasta.

products.name: Rosée Sauce Mix (Pack of 3)
summary: Tired of the same old pasta? It’s time to take it to the next level with something a little fancy but oh-so-easy to make: Rosée Sauce. Creamy with a rich tomato flavor, this thick sauce is very family-friendly and easily clings to your favorite noodles. Make it with two simple ingredients, milk and tomato paste, in just five minutes in the microwave!
